Description:
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException occurs when open the attache report design file

Build number: 
2.2.0.v20070608-0630

Steps to reproduce:
1, Open the attache report design

Expected result:
If the report design is invalud, we just pops up a warning message to tell user

Actual result:
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException occurs

Error log:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.internal.ui.editors.schematic.border.TableBorderHelper.initialize(TableBorderHelper.java:165)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.internal.ui.editors.schematic.border.TableBorderHelper.updateCellBorderInsets(TableBorderHelper.java:287)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.internal.ui.layout.TableLayout.layout(TableLayout.java:146)

Created an attachment (id=70666)
attached design file

The design file has a property as following.
<column>
  <property name="repeat">2</property>
</column>

By current structure, GUI can not support virtual column.
Need investigate how to support virtual column in the future.
Can we improve the error handling only to show proper error message?

We can improve to add validation in model LayoutUtil class to check this case, when column:repeat is set to > 1, it will return false, so UI can know this table  has invalid layout and show a dummy warning item. Also it's better to set this property in ROM to read-only, so user will not able to modify the value through designer.
Please set this property to invisible also.

1.Set repeat property ?hide? in rom.def
2.If repeat value is bigger than one in column slot, this grid/table item is invalid
fix it.

Verified on v20070801 build, there is a red warning in layout to tell user the report item is corrupted, closed!

Regards!
